column4: I just got a replacement laptop, same hardware, because of a physical flaw in the first one.  What's the best way to replicate my Ubuntu install to the new laptop?  I don't want to swap hard drives because the new one has Win 7, and I'd rather screw with Ubuntu than with upgrading Vista->7.
copy the paritions over with pasrtimage ? (does not support ext4 though) then install grub in the mbr
ext4 is the case, though, so that's out.
then use dd ? to replicate the partitions
